intro.description:
In this tutorial, you learn to edit a layer animation.
If the views you need to perform this tutorial are not visible, select Window -> Show View and select the view you want.
Follow the tutorial steps in order.After each step, move to the next step by clicking the button located at the bottom of the step: Click to Perform (if you want the step to be performed automatically), Click to Skip (if you want to perform the step manually) or Click to Complete (if no automatisation is available). If you do not use the buttons to move between steps, the automated tutorial functions become inavailable. To start this tutorial, click the Click to Begin button below.

item.title: Create a new theme.
item.description: In the menu bar, select File -> Create New Theme. A New Theme window opens. In the Theme name field, enter Tutorial4. Click Finish. Click Click to Perform to create a new Theme automatically.

item.title: Select the title bar for editing.
item.description: In the Editor, right-click the title bar of the active screen. From the pop-up menu, select Edit/Animate selected elements. Click Click to Perform to select the title bar automatically.

item.title: Create an animated effect for the title bar.
item.description:
To add a new layer to the title bar, right-click the existing layer in the Layers view and select Add layer. Add an effect to the second layer by right-clicking the second layer and choosing Add effect. Add effect ApplyColor.
To animate the layer, right-click the effect and select Parameters. Check the Animate box for Red. Click Click to Perform to create the animation effect automatically.

item.title: Time the animation.
item.description: Create a control point by right-clicking the timeline in the Animation editor and selecting Create Control Point. Set the time for the control point at 100. In the Animation editor, select the control point at time index 0 and, in the Animated context area, set the amount of red to 100. Similarly, set the amount of red to 200 at the control point at time index 100.

item.title: Preview the animation.
item.description: Click the green play button. Click Click to Perform to preview the animation automatically.

item.title: Save the theme.
item.description: Select File -> Save. Click Click to Perform to save the theme automatically.
